function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Modeling the performance of a standard upper-room uv fitting when challenged by sars-cov-2 may result in inaccurate assessment of its effectiveness","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on published literature and studies for uv-c doses and log reductions without independent validation introduces risk of using potentially inaccurate data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Studies on the susceptibility of different viruses to uv irradiation could lead to the underestimation of the risk of contagion in real-world scenarios.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited experimental studies on the uv irradiation of aerosolized viruses may result in a lack of understanding of the efficacy of uv treatment on airborne transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Aerosolised viruses appear to be more vulnerable to uv damage than when they are suspended in a liquid or on a substrate.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Irradiating the coronavirus in liquid requires a uv-c dose that is in the region 1.8-6.0 times higher than that required when the virus is suspended in air.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The adjustment coefficient c_ur for uv-c dose when the virus is suspended in air may be in a range 0.167-0.545.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Assumptions made regarding z ur value for upper-room uvgi analysis based on published mean z values for aerosolised coronaviruses","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty associated with assumed z ur value and introduction of worst-case scenario","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Direct inverse relationship between z ur, particle residence time, and required irradiation flux","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to uv light may cause harm to human skin and eyes.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequality in susceptibility to uv damage among different coronaviruses.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variability in uv irradiation experiment methodologies and results.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in inactivating sars-cov-1 and mers-cov compared to influenza a","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Substrate or medium influencing the magnitude of the z value achieved for inactivating microbes","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low penetration depth of uv light through concentrated suspensions","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Paucity of good quality data on uv-c irradiation of sars-cov-1, sars-cov-2, and mers-cov in the air","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the validity of using z value for mhv coronavirus as a surrogate for sars-cov-2 in air","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Modeling expected and worst-case scenarios for upper-room uvgi installations","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependence on surrogate z ur values for sars-cov-2","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the effects of fragmented uv doses on virus inactivation","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on room air mixing for effective uvgi air disinfection","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor room air mixing and stagnant regions","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate uv irradiation of larger aerosol particles","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 due to poor ventilation and air movement","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential exposure to uvgi if not properly installed or maintained.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor ventilation efficacy leading to high concentration of viral particles in the room space.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the value of the upper-room uv susceptibility constant for sars-cov-2","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assumption of well-mixed room air may not reflect real-world conditions","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limitations of the model used in assessing upper-room uvgi effectiveness","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on upper-room uvgi as the sole intervention for inhibiting covid-19 transmission in buildings.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spread of sars-cov-2 through contact with contaminated surfaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effectiveness of the anti-sars-cov-2 coatings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unknown chemical groups to inactivate sars-cov-2","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to cuprous oxide as a pesticide and marine antifoulant","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of systemic toxicity associated with copper exposure","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inactivation of sars-cov-2 using cu 2 o particles bound into a film","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exposure to virus due to handling of materials","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate disinfection leading to virus survival on surfaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contaminated equipment and tools as sources of transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of ethanol in the fabrication process","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to argon plasma during cleaning process","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Testing for sars-cov-2 inactivation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to chemicals such as nitric acid and pure gopts","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination risk from unattached polymer chains during film fabrication","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of exposure to cu2o particles during film fabrication and testing","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of biological testing with sars-cov-2","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disinfection process and handling of sars-cov-2","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Handling of infectious materials","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Swift and dramatic inactivation of sars-cov-2 by the cu 2 o/pu coating, reducing the viral titer by 99.9% in 1 hour.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"}]}
